## About the Program
Do you want a leadership position in healthcare, public health or private industry? With our coordinated Public Health/Business Administration degree, you can be prepared for a non-profit or government career, entrepreneurship, or any of a broad range of professions.
Our MPH/MBA program is offered in conjunction with the UAB Collat School of Business. Your MPH will give you a solid foundation in public health centered around an evidence-based public health model. MPH courses, which you can take online, will share up to 12 credit hours of the MBA program, so you can finish your degree in a timely manner. You’ll also have the opportunity to focus additional training in areas such as healthcare organization, health behavior and program development, health policy, and many other areas of public health.
### Concentrations
This program offers a concentration in Population Health and is administered through the Office of Student and Academic Services at the UAB School of Public Health.
## Delivery Methods
### On-Campus
This program delivers most of its content via on-campus, in-person meetings.
### Online Definition
The MPH portion of this program can be taken online.

# MPH/MBA
Format: Online, In-Class
The coordinated [Public Health/Business Administration (MBA) degree program](https://www.uab.edu/business/home/programs/graduate-degrees/mba/dual-degrees/mph-mba) is offered through the UAB School of Public Health (SOPH) and the [UAB Collat School of Business](https://www.uab.edu/business/home/). Earning these two advanced degrees prepares students for a broad range of careers in health care management, entrepreneurship, and leadership.
Students in this coordinated program earn an MPH with a concentration in Population Health. In this individualized concentration, students gain a solid foundation in public health through completion of the [MPH core](https://www.uab.edu/soph/home/graduate/programs/practice-based/mph-core-curriculum) (based on the Evidence-based Public Health framework), an Applied Practice Experience (Internship), and an Integrative Learning Experience (Capstone). Students also select from among all master’s-level Public Health courses (e.g., health economics, strategic planning, health policy) to build a unique curriculum that supports their career goals. Specialized advising is provided to assist students in designing their individualized curriculum.
## Curriculum
Students may complete the MPH portion of this coordinated degree program totally online, in class, or through a mix of online and in-class experiences.
A total of 60 credit hours of coursework are required for the coordinated MPH/MBA. Normally, 42 credit hours are required for the MPH; however, because of the coordinated nature of the degree 12 credit hours from the MBA curriculum are credited to the MPH. This allows students to earn both degrees in reduced time and at reduced cost.
Online students pay less than the out-of-state tuition rate for the MPH portion of this coordinated degree.
[Download Sample Curriculum Planning Sheet (pdf)](https://www.uab.edu/soph/home/images/documents/sample-plans/2025-2026/MBA-MPH-Curriculum-Planning-Sheet.pdf)
## Admission
**Students must apply separately to each program.**
- [Learn how to apply to the School of Public Health](https://www.uab.edu/soph/home/apply/graduate). Students must apply through the [UAB Graduate School](https://www.uab.edu/gradadmissions/online-application).
  - Select "Public Health (MPH)" program, then "On-Ground" format, then "Public Health and Business Administration" concentration.
- [Learn how to apply to the Collat School of Business](https://www.uab.edu/business/home/mba/mba-admission). To apply for the MBA, students must apply through the [UAB Graduate School](https://www.uab.edu/gradadmissions/online-application).
- If a student is submitting to switch from a different degree program or department into a Coordinated Degree or the General MPH in Population Health Degree, the student should meet with the current program manager prior to submitting a petition to switch programs.
[Application Deadlines](https://www.uab.edu/soph/home/apply/graduate#step2)
## Student Spotlight
![Dr. John Ross, (MPH, MBA, 2026)](https://www.uab.edu/soph/home/images/photos/student-experiences/john-ross.jpg)Photo by John Ross
I chose the coordinated MPH/MBA program because of the benefits that the curriculum provides to my career and my future goals of progressing within my organization. I already have a doctoral degree in clinical psychology, but in my current position, I help with the development of educational programs to service 320 clinics nationally and have a need for business foundations and skills. While many schools have remote education opportunities, not every institution accommodates their students the way that UAB does. The infrastructure of the coordinated degree programs really creates an opportunity for those in the middle of their professional career to evaluate whether continuing education is best for them. For a student like me, who has aspirations of integrating public health leadership and business with clinical practice, the MPH/MBA coordinated degree program has really added value to my career.
\- Dr. John Ross (MPH/MBA ‘26)
